intro: Eremogone talassica, commonly known as the sea eremogone, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, succulent stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils near the shoreline, adapting to salt-laden environments. Its yellowish to orange flowers bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Eremogone talassica is well-suited to coastal conditions, demonstrating resilience to wind and salt spray.
